author: Bob Car
content: Talk me through the weight loss stall. 15 pounds off the first 2 weeks, nothing much since, now end of 4th week. No cheating, in fact, I cut out dairy. Steaks, butter, eggs, salt, seafood, mostly crab. Thoughts? Encouragement? I had hoped the scale would keep moving.

replies.content: How many calories are you eating? How many are you burning?
Sheila Peralta, not counting calories. One meal a day, maybe two, depending on hunger.
Anonymous participant At the end of the day weight loss is calories in vs calories out. So, maybe your intake is equal to your output. Can you add some activity to your day?
Sheila Peralta, I swim almost daily and am active with 2 kids. I'll take a look at the calories. Thanks!
Sheila Peralta this has been proven to be oversimplified. Undereating will prevent weight loss. And the human body is an open system, not a closed one.

Sheila Peralta respectfully, even though it is a widely held belief, calorie counting is the wrong road to go down. Losing fat has more to do with mass in/mass out (i.e. grams of fat, protein, and carbs) than calories, which is a measurement of heat en… See more
curious, do you workout and/or are you active during this too?
Toree D'Antonio, swim almost every day. Active with 2 kids.

Weight stalls are normal. This is my journey since January. Ive now lost almost 50lbs. Got off to a great start but overall lost nothing during march. You just have to believe in the process
May be an image of text

Lynn Howard

Sheila Peralta what are you tracking on? App?
Wendy Duffey Garmin. I have a Garmin scale and it saves my weight every time by wifi
Lynn Howard mine looks a lot like that too. From 222 to 147.

Sheila Peralta if everyone tracked their weight loss like we do then it becomes very clear that weight loss is never linear and its a far more complex process than just eat less to lose weight. There is so much more going on. What i have found is that … See more
Lynn Howard You too!

You are probably aware of this already, but try to keep in mind that weight loss and fat loss are not synonymous. What we really want to aim for is fat loss. It's possible to still lose fat while our weight stays the same. The way to know this is to tr… See more
Scott D. Johnston, my waist circumference has definitely decreased. I had just seen such a marked drop on the scale and then nothing! Thanks for taking the time to explain.
try egg fasting you will lose weight
Fasting helps me through plateaus. I only eat brown butter bites for 36 to 48 hours.
Fasting helps me through plateaus. I only eat brown butter bites for 36 to 48 hours.
I have heard that this diet can make your bones more dense. So therefore it will look like you're not losing weight. Just keep that in mind.

Tammy Johnson Kruckmeyer can you please tell me where you saw that? I was recently diagnosed with osteoporosis (before going carnivore) and have been looking for some info on how this WOE affects the bones. Can’t seem to find much.

Anita Khin I don't think it was something stress upon. Like a main subject. It was talking about weight loss and how people. Think they are at a weight stall. But the doctor had said it could be bone density happening. I can't pinpoint which podcast it… See more
Tammy Johnson Kruckmeyer ok. Thx!! I look over on her Podcasts and watch a few. ￼

Not about calories. If you don’t eat enough your body compensates thinking there’s a famine. Eat until you can’t eat another bite. Then only eat when hungry. Absolutely never go hungry or finish eating before full. Stick to Ribeye steak only and drink only water.
I haven’t lost anything in 3 Months. Very disappointing
